channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden will name new boss soon to lead 'toxic' FDIC
item.description: FDIC chairman Martin Gruenberg says he's prepared to step down once a successor is confirmed. Gruenberg has been widely criticized for fostering a toxic workplace at the agency.
item.content:encoded:
FDIC chairman Martin Gruenberg says he's prepared to step down once a successor is confirmed. Gruenberg has been widely criticized for fostering a toxic workplace at the agency.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Scarlett Johansson says she is 'shocked, angered' over new ChatGPT voice
item.description: Johansson says she was approached multiple times by OpenAI to be the voice of ChatGPT, and that she declined. Then the company released a voice assistant that sounded uncannily like her.
item.content:encoded:
Johansson says she was approached multiple times by OpenAI to be the voice of ChatGPT, and that she declined. Then the company released a voice assistant that sounded uncannily like her.

(Image credit: Leon Bennett)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: What to expect next after the sudden death of Iran's president
item.description:
Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has died in a helicopter crash, according to state media. Here's how his death might contribute to instability in Iran and the region.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org. Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has died in a helicopter crash, according to state media. Here's how his death might contribute to instability in Iran and the region.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org. Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: Ahmad Al-Rubaye)

item.title: Iran's President Dies, What Happens Next?
item.description: Iran's president, foreign minister and other officials have died in a helicopter crash. President Raisi was the top elected official in Iran and seen as a possible successor to the Supreme Leader, who has has ultimate power over the government. We'll hear the details from Iran and analysis of what happen next in Iran's government.
item.content:encoded: Iran's president, foreign minister and other officials have died in a helicopter crash. President Raisi was the top elected official in Iran and seen as a possible successor to the Supreme Leader, who has has ultimate power over the government. We'll hear the details from Iran and analysis of what happen next in Iran's government.
item.dc:creator: Peter Kenyon

item.title: Amid record homelessness, a Texas think tank tries to upend how states tackle it
item.description: The conservative Cicero Institute is working with states to ban street camps, and shift money away from housing to addiction treatment. Homelessness advocates says such moves are counterproductive.
item.content:encoded:
The conservative Cicero Institute is working with states to ban street camps, and shift money away from housing to addiction treatment. Homelessness advocates says such moves are counterproductive.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: The International Criminal Court is seeking warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders
item.description: The prosecutor at the International Criminal Court in The Hague said he will seek arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant and three Hamas leaders.
item.content:encoded:
The prosecutor at the International Criminal Court in The Hague said he will seek arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant and three Hamas leaders.

(Image credit: Selman Aksunger)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Biden accuses Trump of 'coming for your health care' in new campaign ad
item.description: The TV ad leans on the Affordable Care Act's popularity among independent voters and alludes to Biden's edge over Trump on health issues.
item.content:encoded: The TV ad leans on the Affordable Care Act's popularity among independent voters and alludes to Biden's edge over Trump on health issues.
item.dc:creator: Phil Galewitz

item.title: Red Lobster files for bankruptcy after missteps including all-you-can-eat shrimp
item.description: The seafood chain is in hot water after a series of bad choices by a parade of executives. Almost 580 restaurants will stay open, after dozens closed abruptly last week.
item.content:encoded:
The seafood chain is in hot water after a series of bad choices by a parade of executives. Almost 580 restaurants will stay open, after dozens closed abruptly last week.

(Image credit: Alina Selyukh)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: What to know about Mohammad Mokhber, who is stepping in as interim president of Iran
item.description: Mohammad Mokhber worked in state-affiliated financial organizations before entering politics. He will lead the Iranian government until its presidential election, which must take place within 50 days.
item.content:encoded: Mohammad Mokhber worked in state-affiliated financial organizations before entering politics. He will lead the Iranian government until its presidential election, which must take place within 50 days.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Jacob Zuma banned from running in South Africa's election
item.description: Former South African president Jacob Zuma has been barred from contesting in next week's elections, South Africa's top court ruled Monday.
item.content:encoded: Former South African president Jacob Zuma has been barred from contesting in next week's elections, South Africa's top court ruled Monday.
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett
